sn46.23:4.1: “Mendicants, when you frequently focus irrationally on things that are grounds for sensual greed, sensual desire arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.
sn46.23:4.2: When you frequently focus irrationally on things that are grounds for ill will, ill will arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.
sn46.23:4.3: When you frequently focus irrationally on things that are grounds for dullness and drowsiness, dullness and drowsiness arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.
sn46.23:4.4: When you frequently focus irrationally on things that are grounds for restlessness and remorse, restlessness and remorse arise, and once arisen they increase and grow.
sn46.23:4.5: When you frequently focus irrationally on things that are grounds for doubt, doubt arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.
sn46.23:5.1: When you frequently focus rationally on things that are grounds for the awakening factor of mindfulness, the awakening factor of mindfulness arises, and once arisen it’s developed to perfection. …
sn46.23:5.2: When you frequently focus rationally on things that are grounds for the awakening factor of equanimity, the awakening factor of equanimity arises, and once arisen it’s developed to perfection.”
